UserCode.UserInterfaces
Interface IDisplayable

All Known Implementing Classes:
Bubble, FishFood, JavaFish, Piranha, SeaHorse, Urchin
public interface IDisplayable

IDisplayable: allows this object to be displayed in a virtual environment of type IWorld. This interface helps preserve an objects encapulsation as it allows the object to be injected into the game world, rather than returning its private DisplayObject. Heavily based off of Chris Blythe's live coding session from Week 16 on BlackBoard, on the 'ISpawnable' interface.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Chris Blythe, Kristopher Randle

Method Summary
abstract  void injectDisplayable(IWorld world)
          METHOD: Inject the IDisplayable by passing its contained DisplayObject into the reference to IWorld provided.
 

Method Detail

injectDisplayable

void injectDisplayable(IWorld world)
                       throws WorldDoesNotExistException
METHOD: Inject the IDisplayable by passing its contained DisplayObject into the reference to IWorld provided. - Must be done after World has been created.

Parameters:
world - IWorld reference representing the 3D world.
Throws:
WorldDoesNotExistException
